SYSTEM: Wiki: https://delicias.dia.fi.upm.es/wiki/index.php/Dong_et_al-data_integration_uncertainty 

for each j oin [1..n], Sum(i in [1..m], Pr(cij) <= 1)
Bayes-Net
can reduce the size of mappings exponentially
however, it does not reduce the complexity of query answering
Complex Mappings
exampleÂ : the address attribute maps to the concatenation of street, city, and state
a complex mapping is (S,T,cm)
cm is a set of set correspondences, such that each attribute in S or T is involved in at most one set correspondence.
Conditional Mappings
example: daytime-phone maps to work-phone with 60% probability if age < 65 and maps to home-phone with 90% is age >= 65
a conditional p-mapping cpM = {(pM1,C1), ..., (pMn, Cn)} where pMi are p-mappings and Ci are pairwise disjoint conditions.
these type of mapping are more related to tuple-semantics.
speaker: SYSTEM
